SYM-ITP-016 - Gross Pollutant Trap & Diversion Structure PV-GPT-2 (RevA)
template name: SYM-ITP-016 - Gross Pollutant Trap & Diversion Structure PV-GPT-2 (RevA)

name: 1.0 General Details
• Prepare the excavation for the Vortceptor separation chamber first.
• Did the excavation for the Diversion Chamber (the rectangular precast concrete chamber) follow afterwards the Vortceptor.
• Was the inlet pipe run would installed, within one or two pipe lengths prior to the diversion chamber.
• Is the work area clearly pegged out for line and level?
• Zone
• Stage
• Were all identified underground services marked and potholed to confirm location and depth and no machine excavation within 1m of underground services.
• Relevant permits have been signed and approved? Attach Completed Permits.
• Extents and levels correct to relevant drawings
• 50mm Blinding to be placed as required to allow working surface and protect excavation.
• Excavation for Vortceptor to a total depth of
• Excavation for Diversion Chamber to a total depth of
HOLD POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
2.0 Vortceptor Installation
• Were measurements checked on the Vortceptor prior to installation, and confirmd as per approved IFC

• The Vortceptor excavation should be no greater than required, this would be 1000mm oversized or to suit shield sizing. This is with due regard to the amount of backfill to be used under and around the tank.
• Were 150mm thick, compacted base of either a concrete blinding or compacted crushed rock layer installed.
• Was the Vortceptor lowered into the excavation with no rocks or sharp objects falling into the hole and no damage to the tank
• Were the levels of the Vortceptor adjusted to suit pipeworks and diversion chamber inlet void?
• Fill the tank with water up to the invert of the inlet
• Encase & backfill the outside of Vortceptor as per project backfilling specs

• Is the take located in an area subject to high water table or trapped underground water? If yes, the tank must be completely encased in unreinforced concrete, up to the specified height above the Vortceptor base, and at the minimum specified width beyond the perimeter of the Vortceptor base.  Refer to SPEL Stormwater for recommended concrete dimensions and volumes to withstand buoyancy forces.
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
WITNESS POINT - Signature by IR
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• Were measurements checked on the Diversion Chamber prior to installation, and confirmd as per approved IFC
• Has the diversion chamber excavation pit been prepared as per Construction drawings
• Is sufficient room left to install inlet pipe and pipe is angled to be fed into the diversion chamber?
• Was the Diversion Chamber adjusted to a correct level so the rectangular opening matches the Vortceptor with the inlet and outlet block outs are to match the drainage line.
• Use the template provided with the Vortceptor to drill the bolt holes into the diversion chamber rectangular void.
• Use Sikaflex or silicone to seal the Vortceptor to the Diversion Chamber, use 8.5mm 4 cutter SDS bit to drill the bolt holes.
• Use M8 x 100mm Galvanised screw bolts to fix the Vortceptor to the Diversion Chamber.
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
WITNESS POINT - Signature by IR
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• Were upstream and downstream drainage pipework Installed?
• Connect the pipework to the Diversion Chamber, concrete bandage the inlet and outlet pipes to the Diversion Chamber.
• Internally render the inlet and outlet pipework
• Use low slump concrete to mass infill and bench the base of the diversion chamber and weir. This is to direct the flow and remove any dead zones in the diversion chamber.
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• Use a Sikaflex bead around the rebate on the top of the Diversion Chamber to ensure a satisfactory seal between cover slab (Lid) and chamber.
• Lift and install cover slab, ensure manhole void / cover is on Vortceptor side of the chamber.
• Use Sikaflex and screw bolts to secure fibreglass manhole riser to cover slab
• Tie in the manhole covers as per lid manufacturers installation guidelines, to achieve Finished Surface level.
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off

Request Sign Off
• Have the existing pits been raised/lowered to meet the surface level of Asphalt?
2.0 Hot Mix Asphalt Installation

• The placement of asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until approval to proceed is obtained from CYP D&C JV.
• Approval to proceed?
HOLD POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• All transverse joints shall be offset from layer to layer by at least 2 m.
• Longitudinal joints in the wearing course shall coincide with the location of intended traffic lane lines.

• Longitudinal joints in intermediate and base courses shall be offset from layer to layer by not less than 150 mm and shall be within 300 mm of the traffic lane line or the centre of traffic lane. Where new pavement abuts an existing full depth asphalt pavement, the existing pavement shall be removed in steps to achieve an offset from layer to layer of not less than 150 mm.
• Has all of the above been completed?
INSPECTION POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
INSPECTION POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off

• At junctions where the new asphalt mat is required to match the level of existing pavement surface at the limits of work, chases shall be cut into the existing pavement by cold planing as specified in Section 402.
• Does new Asphalt Layer match the existing pavement surface with chases cut?
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
INSPECTION POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off

• Asphalt shall be spread in layers at the compacted thicknesses shown on the drawings or specified. Asphalt shall be uniformly compacted Compaction shall not commence until the asphalt has cooled sufficiently to support the rollers without undue displacement.
• Has all of the above been completed?
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
WITNESS POINT - Signature by IR
INSPECTION POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
3.0 Completion and Compliance
• Thickness < 50 mm: 94.0% Characteristic Density Ratio
• Thickness > 50mm: 96.0% Characteristic Density Ratio
• Has testing been completed and report received? Do results match requirements?
WITNESS POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
WITNESS POINT - Signature by IR
REVIEW POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• The mean surface level and the variation in surface level for the base, intermediate and wearing courses within each lot shall meet the requirements (mean +/- 5mm, standard deviation 8mm)
• Rectification of surface levels shall not commence until approval to proceed is obtained from the Superintendent.
• Is finished surface level acceptable and survey conformance report received? Attach Reports.
HOLD POINT - Signature by CYP D&C JV
HOLD POINT - Signature by Symal Infrastructure
Request Sign Off
• Surface finish - Uniform in appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches, and roller marks.
• Kerb & Channel - Flush or not more than 5mm above lip of channel
• Shape – For intermediate and base course layers, the distance below the straight edge shall not exceed 6 mm and 10 mm, respectively.
• Alignment - Where asphalt pavement is not placed against a concrete edging, the edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50 mm inside nor more than 100 mm outside.

• Width - Where asphalt pavement is not placed against a concrete edging, the width of asphalt layers shall not be less than the design or specified width of layer by more than 50 mm or greater than the design or specified width by more than 100 mm.
• Have the above requirements been met and surface is acceptable?

• Transverse joints shall be constructed at regular intervals not exceeding 2.5 m. The resultant slot in the edging shall be tooled to a depth of 20 mm to produce a neat groove not less than 5 mm wide on the exposed surfaces.

• Expansion joints shall be placed at junctions with bridges and shall be 15 mm wide and filled with cork or bituminous impregnated particle board strip extending for the full width and full depth of the edging.
• Are joints installed and comply with all specifications?
• Freshly finished exposed concrete surfaces shall be protected from rain or damage from other sources, until hard set has occurred.
• All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.
• Are finished curbs protected and free from damage?
• For damaged kerb and channel and edgings, a length of at least 1 m shall be removed and the replacement section shall be:
(a) Constructed on compacted bedding;
(b) Dowelled into the adjoining sections with 12 mm diameter hot dip galvanised dowels embedded at least 100 mm each side of the joint; and
(c) Shaped and finished with curved trowels to match the profile and surface finish of adjoining sections
